comment.narrative: - LostFootsteps.org: Successfully managed website. New content researched, produced and posted with a frequency of approximately 4 new articles/posts per month, with a terrific audience engagement and response (as of May 2020: nearly 500,000 unique users and 1.5 million page views). - Our U Thant House Facebook-page is maintained but only used sporadically, mainly to document events/seminars held and occasional posts related to U Thant. The average rate of posting is 2 times per month. The number of followers as of April 2020 was 70,000. Our website www.uthanthouse.org containing basic information only.

title.narrative: Topics identified and highlighted by U Thant House have been introduced to the Myanmar public and are increasingly being discussed.

description.narrative: Research & Dialogue Programme – Transforming Public Debate. To transform public debate around key issues facing the country and to help identify creative solutions through the hosting of seminars and discussions in the neutral space of U Thant House. To identify pressing issues currently neglected in Myanmar public debate with the aim of bringing attention to those issues and help set the agenda for discussion among influencers, policy and decisionmakers and generate new ideas and approaches in tackling those issues. and provide a window onto global debates to enable new thinking about local challenges and new ways to reimagine the future.

comment.narrative: - One big annual lecture held (200 participants in January 2020). - Occasional seminars and roundtable discussions held (4 in 2018, 6 in 2019) on ad hoc topics, but with no regular frequency, 12-25 participants in each. - Brief articles for website and Facebook page documenting event. - Currently no dissemination of knowledge on the topic discussed. No preparatory research, or consultations done. No presentations or notes from the seminars produced.
